intro: Phoebanthus tenuifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phoebanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of East Asia, including China and Japan, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
